math_10.subject: math
math_10.title: Grade 10 Math Diagnostic
math_10.description: Placement for algebra, geometry, functions, and data analysis.

items.prompt: Solve for x: 3x + 7 = 22
Factor the expression: x² - 9
Solve the system: y = 2x + 1 and y = x + 4. Find x.
Simplify: (2x³)(3x²)
What is the slope of the line y = -2x + 5?
In a right triangle, if one leg is 3 and the other is 4, what is the hypotenuse?
What is the area of a circle with radius 4? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
Two angles are supplementary. If one is 70°, what is the other?
What is the volume of a rectangular prism with length 5, width 3, and height 2?
If two triangles are similar and one has sides 3, 4, 5 and the other has a side of 6 corresponding to the side of 3, what is the scale factor?
If f(x) = 2x + 3, what is f(4)?
What is the y-intercept of y = 3x - 7?
Which graph represents a quadratic function?
What is the domain of f(x) = √x?
What is the mean of: 4, 6, 8, 10, 12?
What is the median of: 3, 7, 9, 12, 15?
In a standard normal distribution, what percentage of data falls within 1 standard deviation of the mean?
A coin is flipped twice. What is the probability of getting heads both times?

ela_10.subject: ela
ela_10.title: Grade 10 ELA Diagnostic
ela_10.description: Literary analysis, rhetoric, vocabulary, and writing skills.

items.prompt: In literature, what is 'foreshadowing'?

options.text: Hints about what will happen later

items.prompt: What is the difference between a protagonist and an antagonist?

options.text: One is good, one is evil
One is fictional, one is real

items.prompt: 'The wind howled angrily' is an example of which literary device?
What does 'theme' refer to in literature?
'Life is like a box of chocolates' is an example of:
What is 'ethos' in persuasive writing?
Which is an example of a logical fallacy?

options.text: Using statistics to support a claim
Attacking the person instead of the argument

items.prompt: What is the purpose of a counterargument in an essay?

options.text: To address opposing views and strengthen your argument

items.prompt: What is 'pathos' in rhetorical appeals?
Which source would be MOST credible for a research paper?
What does 'ambiguous' mean?
What does 'ubiquitous' mean?
The prefix 'anti-' means:
What does 'pragmatic' mean?
What should a thesis statement do?

options.text: State the main argument or claim

items.prompt: Which sentence uses a semicolon correctly?

options.text: I went to the store; and bought milk.
I was tired; I went to bed early.
The dog; ran across the yard.

items.prompt: What is the purpose of a topic sentence?

options.text: To introduce the main idea of a paragraph

items.prompt: Which transition word shows cause and effect?

science_10.subject: science
science_10.title: Grade 10 Science Diagnostic
science_10.description: Chemistry, biology, physics, and earth science fundamentals.

items.prompt: What is the atomic number of an element?
What type of bond forms when electrons are shared between atoms?
Which of the following is a chemical change?
What does pH measure?
In a balanced chemical equation, what is conserved?
What is the primary function of mitochondria?
DNA is composed of building blocks called:
What is the process by which plants convert sunlight to energy?
What carries genetic information from parent to offspring?
What is natural selection?

options.text: Survival and reproduction of organisms best adapted to their environment

items.prompt: Newton's First Law states that an object at rest will:

options.text: Stay at rest unless acted on by a force

items.prompt: What is the SI unit for force?
If an object has a mass of 5 kg and an acceleration of 2 m/s², what is the force? (F = ma)
What is kinetic energy?
What causes Earth's seasons?
What type of plate boundary causes earthquakes and volcanic activity at subduction zones?
What is the main cause of climate change according to scientific consensus?
Which layer of Earth's atmosphere contains the ozone layer?
